intro: Husemannia, commonly known as the sea holly, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, spiky flower heads that resemble holly berries, often surrounded by bracts that give it a unique appearance. These plants are typically found in coastal areas and saline environments, showcasing their adaptability to harsh conditions. Husemannia species are known for their ability to thrive in sandy soils and are often used in coastal landscaping. Their flowers attract various pollinators, contributing to their ecological significance.
